abstain.definition: Restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something
examples: During Lent, many religious people decide to abstain from something to focus more clearly on God
I am trying to abstain from sweets for my new diet

active.definition: Engaging or ready to engage in physically energetic pursuits
examples: Though past retirement age he is still active in his profession
Although he was seventy he was still robust and active
He simply just adored his wife
Lon and the others adore him
She made sure the door was ajar so that she could hear what was going on inside the room
The back door was ajar so that the dog could come and go

aquiesce.definition: Accept something reluctantly but without protest
examples: He will acquiesce simply because he is a sick man
The committee will acquiesce in any decision on which it is not fully informed
